intro: Hymenocallis pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact size and striking white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, strap-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Hymenocallis pygmaea thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a delicate yet resilient plant.
